config.segmentationDefinition: Segment the video at each distinct point, question, answer, or statement in the conversation between Asha Sharma and Eric Boyd. Capture micro-transitions in topics, subtle changes in tone, and individual talking points. Aim for an average of 6.0-8.0 segments per minute to ensure fine-grained capture of conversational nuances. Each segment should represent a single coherent thought, statement, or reaction.

StartTimeMs.description: Start time of this segment in milliseconds.

EndTimeMs.description: End time of this segment in milliseconds.

Description.description: Natural language description of what happens or is discussed in this segment.

FocusTopic.description: Primary topic or theme of this segment, if identifiable.

SpeakerTransition.description: Whether there's a speaker transition in this segment.

KeyPoints.description: Summary of the important points or takeaways in this segment.

AudienceReaction.description: Estimated reaction from any visible or audible audience, if applicable.

CommentaryExcitement.description: Estimated overall excitement or energy level in the conversation at this moment.

NonverbalEngagement.description: Level of nonverbal engagement between speakers.

InsightLevel.description: How insightful or novel the information in this segment is.

ContentValue.description: Score (0.0-1.0) for informational value of the segment.

EntertainmentValue.description: Score (0.0-1.0) for entertainment or engagement value.

QuoteWorthiness.description: Score (0.0-1.0) for how quotable or shareable this segment is.

CentralToDiscussion.description: Whether this segment addresses a central theme of the overall conversation.

HighlightScore.description: AI-generated highlight-worthiness score between 0.0 and 1.0, combining content value, entertainment value, and relevance.
